definition[0]: to become happier, or to make someone happier
example[0]: Come on, buck up, things aren’t that bad!
example[1]: You need something to buck you up.
definition[1]: used to tell someone to hurry up
example[2]: Buck up, John! We’ll be late.
definition[2]: to improve, or to make something improve
example[3]: It’ll be a long time before the situation starts to buck up.
example[4]: a company that is looking to buck up its networking capabilities
definition[3]: used to tell someone to improve their behaviour or attitude
